Description: Small fragment of light grey marble corner cyma. The ca. 4,5 cm high fragment shows the base of an angle palmette and concave fronts. At the back an angle rib and tendrils can be seen. Traces of blue paint were found.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (Attributed by Petrie to the 'second temple of Apollo'.)
Curator's comments: This fragment belongs to the exterior cornice of an Ionic cyma, however to a different corner than fragment B 409 although both are similar decorated. Furthermore, it shows that the corner leaf does not end with an angle palmette. The “remains of blue paint” mentioned by Pryce was not identified in 1999 anymore. Published (Koenigs 2007, 330 Cat. 18; Petrie 1886, 14 No. 14, Pl. 14 No. 1 (14 A left below); Altekamp, 136ff. No. 1 Fig. 123 (with B413)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B407)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIV A, bottom left)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.18, p.330, pl. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.27) (Phase 3)
